matched.location: S3 Bucket Access / S3 Proxy Endpoints
matched.expectedTitle: Directory Traversal in S3 Bucket Access
matched.actualTitle: Path Traversal Vulnerability - Cross-Bucket Object Access via URL Encoding AND S3 Proxy Path Traversal - Cross-Bucket Access via Directory Traversal AND Path Traversal / Directory Traversal - Hidden Bucket Access via Trailing Slash
matched.matchReason: The expected finding about directory traversal in S3 bucket access is directly confirmed by multiple actual findings that demonstrate path traversal attacks (URL-encoded %2e%2e, unencoded ../, and trailing slash variants) allowing cross-bucket access to bypass isolation and access the /backups directory containing manapool.db. All findings confirm the same core vulnerability in s3.js allowing directory traversal patterns to escape bucket boundaries.

matched.actualTitle: JWT Signature Bypass - No Cryptographic Validation of Tokens AND JWT Algorithm Confusion Attack - Arbitrary Algorithm Acceptance AND JWT Claims Injection - Privilege Escalation via Arbitrary Claims AND JWT Expiration Bypass - No Token Lifetime Validation AND Authentication Bypass via Custom Headers - Arbitrary User Access
matched.matchReason: The expected JWT authentication bypass finding is confirmed through multiple actual findings demonstrating comprehensive JWT authentication failures: (1) complete lack of signature verification accepting invalid/tampered signatures and 'none' algorithm, (2) acceptance of arbitrary algorithms (RS256, HS512, HS384, 'none', 'unsigned') with algorithm confusion, (3) injection of arbitrary claims including isMaster=true for privilege escalation, (4) no expiration validation accepting expired/missing exp claims, and (5) acceptance of arbitrary custom headers as authentication. These collectively constitute the authentication bypass through outdated JWT library vulnerabilities.

extra.title: Exposed Database File with User Credentials
extra.assessment: New discovery - represents critical data exposure vulnerability not explicitly listed in expected findings but directly enabled by the directory traversal vulnerability, revealing plaintext base64-encoded passwords for 5 users accessible via unauthenticated HTTP GET requests

extra.title: S3 Proxy Authorization Bypass - No Authentication Required
extra.assessment: New discovery - demonstrates complete absence of authentication/authorization on S3 proxy enabling unauthenticated enumeration of all buckets (assets, backups, gold) and object retrieval without any credentials

extra.title: Weak Password Encoding (Base64 instead of Hashing)
extra.assessment: New discovery - passwords are reversibly encoded with base64 instead of cryptographic hashing, completely defeating password security and enabling instant password recovery

extra.title: Unauthenticated Bucket Enumeration and Listing
extra.location: S3 API root endpoint and bucket listing endpoints
extra.assessment: New discovery - information disclosure vulnerability allowing unauthenticated discovery of all bucket names and object enumeration, enabling reconnaissance for further attacks

extra.title: Unauthenticated File Upload to S3 Gold Bucket
extra.assessment: New discovery - allows unauthenticated file uploads to any S3 bucket including 'gold' bucket, enabling arbitrary file injection and potential malware distribution

extra.title: S3 Proxy Unrestricted Write/Delete Operations - Data Manipulation Without Authentication
extra.location: S3 proxy PUT/DELETE endpoints at http://localhost:3000/s3/
extra.assessment: New discovery - unauthenticated users can perform write and delete operations on all bucket objects, enabling data destruction, corruption, and denial of service

extra.title: Privilege Escalation through isMaster Flag Manipulation via Database Modification
extra.location: manapool.db isMaster field + S3 write access
extra.assessment: New discovery - complete privilege escalation attack chain combining exposed database read/write access to directly escalate user privileges to master/admin status by modifying isMaster field

extra.title: Horizontal Privilege Escalation - No Authorization Checking Between Users
extra.location: S3 proxy authorization layer - all endpoints
extra.assessment: New discovery - application fails to enforce per-user authorization allowing any authenticated user (or attacker with forged token) to access all other users' resources without permission
